intro: Hydnophytum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hydnophytum, is a climbing epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its unique ability to form symbiotic relationships with fungi, which aid in nutrient absorption. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Hydnophytum stenophyllum is often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments.
